Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Piperacillin-tazobactam
BD Phoenix™ Automated Microbiology System piperacillin-tazobactam
BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent piperacillin-tazobactam
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System addition of piperacillin-tazobactam for antimicrobial susceptibility testing using broth microdilution and redox/turbidity detection
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of most Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria from pure culture, including Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, and Streptococcus, using piperacillin-tazobactam in Gram positive ID/AST or AST only Phoenix panels
